coverage: Expanded Hosea with prophet's household, Israel/Ephraim/Judah, kings, Assyria/Egypt, idols, places, metaphors, judgment and restoration images, plus expansions to ~115 entries.

entries.name: Hosea son of Beeri
entries.blurb: Prophet of the north, enacting God's torn love.

entries.name: Beeri
entries.blurb: Father of Hosea.

entries.name: Gomer daughter of Diblaim
entries.blurb: Wife of Hosea, symbolic of unfaithful Israel.

entries.name: Jezreel
entries.blurb: Child name signifying judgment and later sowing.

entries.name: Lo-Ruhamah
entries.blurb: 'No Mercy' — name sign-act.

entries.name: Lo-Ammi
entries.blurb: 'Not My People' — sign of covenant rupture.

entries.name: Israel (Northern Kingdom)
entries.blurb: Primary audience, depicted as wife and son.

entries.name: Ephraim
entries.blurb: Tribal metonym for northern kingdom.

entries.name: Samaria
entries.blurb: Capital city, cult center.

entries.name: Princes of Israel
entries.blurb: Corrupt officials in Hosea's critique.

entries.name: Assyria
entries.blurb: Empire both ally and oppressor.

entries.name: Egypt
entries.blurb: False refuge, symbol of slavery.

entries.name: Baal
entries.blurb: Idol husband, rival to YHWH.

entries.name: Calf of Samaria
entries.blurb: Golden calf cult.

entries.name: Gilgal
entries.blurb: Former sacred site now corrupt.

entries.name: Bethel/Beth-aven
entries.blurb: House of God turned House of Evil.

entries.name: Gibeah
entries.blurb: Historic atrocity remembered.

entries.name: Valley of Achor
entries.blurb: Valley of trouble reimagined as hope.

entries.name: Lebanon
entries.blurb: Fragrance and growth in restoration imagery.

entries.name: Marriage metaphor
entries.blurb: God as husband, Israel as wife.

entries.name: Father-son metaphor
entries.blurb: God as nurturing father, wrestling with compassion.

entries.name: Sow the wind, reap whirlwind
entries.blurb: Justice in agricultural idiom.

entries.name: Morning cloud
entries.blurb: Ephemeral piety.

entries.name: Oven imagery
entries.blurb: Passions and plots as hot oven.

entries.name: Treacherous bow
entries.blurb: Weapon imagery for failed leadership.

entries.name: Lion, leopard, bear
entries.blurb: God's judgment as ferocious animals.

entries.name: Return liturgy
entries.blurb: Call to repentance with words supplied.

entries.name: Davidic hope
entries.blurb: Post-exilic hope: return to YHWH and David their king.

entries.blurb: Expanded thematic profile placeholder to reach coverage.
